statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -5 \\ -3 \\ -5 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 2 \\ -5 \\ -5 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -10 \\ 9 \\ -7 \\ -5 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -5 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 22 \\ 7 \\ 6 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -5 \\ -3 \\ -5 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 2 \\ -5 \\ -5 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -10 \\ 9 \\ -7 \\ -5 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -5 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 22 \\ 7 \\ 6 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
